annotation: The nisser in this story act more or less like farmhands. The motif of the discovery of coins in the rim of the barrel is reminiscent of earlier story that Peder tells (PJ 1.02).
danish_manuscript:
Nisserne i Mollerup spilt Kort ved en Skjæppe
De kunde træffe om Morgenen at finde Penge
om i Kanten af den, s. de spildte da om
Penge.
english_manuscript: The nisser at Mollerup sat playing cards on a barrel. In the morning people would sometimes find coins in its rim, so they were playing for money.
danish_publication: Nisserne i Mollerup sad og spilte kort ved en skjæppe, som de vendte bunden i vejret på. De spilte også om penge, for folkene kunde træffe om morgenen at finde penge siddende om i kanten af den.
english_publication: The nisser at Mollerup sat and played cards on a barrel that they had tipped upside down. They played for money, too, and in the morning people would sometimes find money in the barrel's rim.
